result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ameer A Johnson

records.addlTxt: Spoke with Aurora at JS at 4:01 pm.

11:37 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ameer A Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Ameer A Johnson. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Johnson states that the DE was in custody at the last hearing. Court will vacate the warrant and reinstate the bond. Attorney Johnson states he received an offer from the State, but is requesting an adjournment so he may meet with the DE to discuss if he would like to accept or reject the State's offer. The State does not object. Court adjourns. The State will prepare a writ for the next hearing.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:40 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.   No appearance by the Defendant. Attorney Seth Johnson appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Johnson does not have an explanation as to why the DE is not here, but advises the Court that the DE is homeless. Based on the DE's non-appearance the Court forfeits bond and issues a bench warrant with $200.00 cash bond.
Notice of assignment of judge returned. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Teresa L.or any Lou Perrine's in Kenosha, WI

02:34 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State under supervision of Attorney Brost.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz. Clerk PU.   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am. $400  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). rb
and witness list filed by the State
